children.subject: Thanks for the updates! Even though they're not open having this info is useful. :)
No news is still news! Thanks for keeping us updated!

Do we have any sense of what information we're waiting on from the Registrar's Office?

If students wanted to complain to the central campus about the department being forced into this position, what change would we be asking for?

I totally understand that you and the CS department are doing all you can, but in the theme of a thread from a while ago asking who is to blame for problems with room bookings etc. I'd like to understand where the university is failing that has lead to most of the department's lower division classes being closed so late into enrollment.
I have the same question, are they just closed for now, or are they not being offered next semester?

The intention is that they will be offered. That's why they still show on classes.berkeley.edu. When we close classes because they won't be offered, we remove them from the schedule to prevent confusion.
These courses are still highly like to be opened for enrollment, right?
Try again - the wait list had maxed out & I increased it a little while ago.
I'm currently trying to join the cs188 waitlist but it says that there are no more spots on the waitlist. Other people seem to be able to join without problem, why am I not able to join the waitlist?

"When I open the classes for enrollment, I will create individual postings for each class here & call out in the subject line to make it very obvious the class is opened"

Also it's the weekend
Does this mean that the lower division courses will be open for incoming freshman in their phase 1?
I expect CS 189/289A to open before phase 2. When I have more relevant information, I will create a separate post about that class only.

So will these CS courses only be open once Phase 2 comes around? I think it would be a little unfair to just randomly open up a course like CS189 during the middle of Phase 1 because as a rising Senior I completely lose my priority enrollment to lower grades. This would be a bummer and might cause me to become way back on the waitlist. There should be some way to guarantee that I enroll in 189 before lower grades do

160, see @9445...both enrollment and wait list are full.

161 - class is full but there's space on the wait list. You can see this information on classes.berkeley.edu.

We JUST got classrooms assigned and the following classes will open tomorrow (Wed. 5/1) morning at 8am!

CS 61A

CS 61C

CS 195

You're being notified now so that everyone has a chance to see the information before the classes open.

The remainder of the closed classes will be opened as soon as possible. For CS C8, CS 162, and CS 189/289A, there remain some open enrollment issues that should be resolved soon and allow us to open those classes by the end of this week.

For updates about other CompSci classes, please see posts @9146 and @9147.

history.content:
Please see post @9113 to learn more about this situation.

We have been asking for daily updates from the Registrar's office regarding the following closed classes:

  • CS C8 (Data 8)
  • CS 61A
  • CS 61C
  • CS 189

At this time there has been NO CHANGE in their status and the classes remain closed. In addition:

  • CS 88 remains closed as no instructor has been named to teach the class.
  • CS 162 remains closed because the day/time/location may change. (see post @9191 for more info)
  • CS 195 remains closed due to the CS 61A issue. (see post @9174 for more info)

In an effort to reduce confusion, I have also set enrollment to zero for these classes (as well as Dept Consent) to show that the class is closed. Unfortunately it seems to kick up a message in CalCentral that the class is on wait list status. That is not true - the classes are CLOSED and you cannot wait list or get permission to enroll right now.

Sorry I don't have better news for you - or even ANY news. I figured it was better to hear there was no change than to wonder if you had missed anything.

When I open the classes for enrollment, I will create individual postings for each class here & call out in the subject line to make it very obvious the class is opened.

Thank you for your continued patience.
history.subject: F19: CLOSED CS Classes - NO CHANGE
